function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Scholars designing energy programs may overlook the impact of electric vehicles on sustainability, leading to potential negative consequences.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The promotion of electric vehicles may lead to increased car-based mobility and a decrease in the use of active and public transportation modes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The use of electric vehicles may contribute to urban sprawl and increased competition with public transport and shared services.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pandemic complicating efforts to realize a ’just transition’.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Vulnerability of global society to disconnection bans and energy bill deferral.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exacerbation of existing health care inequalities among minority groups due to the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Compounding environmental injustices due to covid-19 impact on vulnerable populations","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Usurpation of regulatory processes by powerful incumbent interests during the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for increased transmission of contagious diseases due to disrupted supply chains and altered social practices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty regarding the lasting impact of the pandemic on social and political practices, including telework, travel, and mobility.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
